1.text: Every wise woman hath builded her house, And the foolish with her hands breaketh it down.

2.text: Whoso is walking in his uprightness is fearing Jehovah, And the perverted in his ways is despising Him.

3.text: In the mouth of a fool is a rod of pride, And the lips of the wise preserve them.

4.text: Without oxen a stall is clean, And great is the increase by the power of the ox.

5.text: A faithful witness lieth not, And a false witness breatheth out lies.

6.text: A scorner hath sought wisdom, and it is not, And knowledge to the intelligent is easy.

7.text: Go from before a foolish man, Or thou hast not known the lips of knowledge.

8.text: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way, And the folly of fools is deceit.

9.text: Fools mock at a guilt-offering, And among the upright—a pleasing thing.

10.text: The heart knoweth its own bitterness, And with its joy a stranger doth not intermeddle.

11.text: The house of the wicked is destroyed, And the tent of the upright flourisheth.

12.text: There is a way—right before a man, And its latter end are ways of death.

13.text: Even in laughter is the heart pained, And the latter end of joy is affliction.

14.text: From his ways is the backslider in heart filled, And a good man—from his fruits.

15.text: The simple giveth credence to everything, And the prudent attendeth to his step.

16.text: The wise is fearing and turning from evil, And a fool is transgressing and is confident.

17.text: Whoso is short of temper doth folly, And a man of wicked devices is hated.

18.text: The simple have inherited folly, And the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

19.text: The evil have bowed down before the good, And the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

20.text: Even of his neighbour is the poor hated, And those loving the rich are many.

21.text: Whoso is despising his neighbour sinneth, Whoso is favouring the humble, O his happiness.

22.text: Do not they err who are devising evil? And kindness and truth are to those devising good,

23.text: In all labour there is advantage, And a thing of the lips is only to want.

24.text: The crown of the wise is their wealth, The folly of fools is folly.

25.text: A true witness is delivering souls, And a deceitful one breatheth out lies.

26.text: In the fear of Jehovah is strong confidence, And to His sons there is a refuge.

27.text: The fear of Jehovah is a fountain of life, To turn aside from snares of death.

28.text: In the multitude of a people is the honour of a king, And in lack of people the ruin of a prince.

29.text: Whoso is slow to anger is of great understanding, And whoso is short in temper is exalting folly.

30.text: A healed heart is life to the flesh, And rottenness to the bones is envy.

31.text: An oppressor of the poor reproacheth his Maker, And whoso is honouring Him Is favouring the needy.

32.text: In his wickedness is the wicked driven away, And trustful in his death is the righteous.

33.text: In the heart of the intelligent wisdom doth rest. And in the midst of fools it is known.

34.text: Righteousness exalteth a nation, And the goodliness of peoples is a sin-offering.

35.text: The favour of a king is to a wise servant, And an object of his wrath is one causing shame!
